cell_type.description: Extract and specify the name or names of the primary cell type(s) from the provided biological context. Use standard cell type terminology. Leave blank if not specified.

disease.description: Extract and specify the disease or pathological condition from the provided biological context (e.g., 'IDH-mutant astrocytoma', 'Alzheimer disease', 'multiple sclerosis'). Use standard disease terminology. Leave blank if not specified.

tissue.description: Extract and specify the tissue or anatomical location if mentioned in the biological context (e.g., 'brain', 'cerebral cortex', 'hippocampus'). Leave blank if not specified.

items.description: A gene program, relevant to the provided context. Avoid programs that group 2 or more loosely related processes

program_name.description: Provide a concise, descriptive name for this gene program that captures its primary biological function or pathway. Use 2-5 words maximum.

description.description: A more detailed description of the gene program.

atomic_biological_processes.description: A list of atomic biological process terms extracted from the description.

atomic_cellular_components.description: A list of atomic cellular component terms extracted from the description.

items.description: Concise bullet-level impacts (e.g., ‘enhanced focal adhesion signaling’)

significance_score.description: A value between 0 and 1 that ranks this gene program by the number of supporting genes, the number of supporting references and relevance to the context.

citations.description: Array of citations supporting the role of the listed genes in this gene program.

required_genes_not_in_input.description: Genes required for this program that are NOT present in the input genes.

method.description: Optional trace of how programs were derived

clustering_basis.description: e.g., pathway databases, co-citation, PPI, co-expression
